page.title: 01LAUGHTON - ITS MAIN FEATURES
page.content: {LAUGHTON}is a small village in the heart of the Sussex countryside. It has five main features. The pub, called{The Roebuck,}is mentioned in the first Domesday Book. For many years it even sold water to the villagers, who could not obtain it anywhere else. It is not a typical village pub, being better known as a Cabaret Inn. The{school}was completed in 1872. It has 79 children arranged in three classes. The{church}serves not just Laughton, but the nearby villages of Ripe and Chalvington as well. {Laughton Stores}is the village shop. It sells a wide variety of goods. Some local residents work at{Laughton {Lodge,}a nearby mental hospital.
